Administration.text:
Type: Prostaglandin
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: IV, nebulized
Common Trade Names: Flolan

Adult_Dosing.text:
IV: 2 ng/kg/min initially, titrate upward by 2 ng/kg/min q15m until intolerance or dose-limiting effects occur. Avoid abrupt withdrawal: gradually decrease dose by 2ng/kg/min q15min.
Nebulized: dosing not well standardized, usually 12.5-50 ng/kg/min

Pediatric_Dosing.text: Safety/efficacy not well established (though some PICUs do use it)

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: B
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out

Common.text:
Tachycardia, bradyarrythmia
Hypotension
Nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain
Flushing
Headache, dizziness
Musculoskeletal pain

Tachycardia, bradyarrythmia
Hypotension
Nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain

Musculoskeletal pain

Hypotension

Flushing

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: ~6 min
Metabolism: Extensively and rapidly metabolized in blood
Excretion: Mostly renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Prostaglandinâ†’ stimulates vasodilation of pulmonary and systemic arteries. Also inhibits platelet aggregation.
